title.raw: 《秦始皇本紀》 Annals of Qin Shi Huang

sentences.zh: 秦始皇帝者，秦莊襄王子也。

translations.literal: Qin Shi Huang Di was Qin Zhuang Xiang Wang's son.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Shi Huang was the son of King Zhuang Xiang of Qin.

sentences.zh: 莊襄王為秦質子於趙，見呂不韋姬，悅而取之，生始皇。

translations.literal: Zhuang Xiang Wang was Qin hostage in Zhao, saw Lu Bu Wei's concubine, pleased and took her, gave birth to Shi Huang.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhuang Xiang was a Qin hostage in Zhao. He saw Lü Buwei's concubine, was pleased with her, and took her. She gave birth to Shi Huang.

sentences.zh: 以秦昭王四十八年正月生於邯鄲。

translations.literal: In Qin Zhao Wang forty-eighth year first month born in Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: He was born in Handan in the first month of King Zhao of Qin's forty-eighth year.

sentences.zh: 及生，名為政，姓趙氏。

translations.literal: When born, named Zheng, surname Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: When he was born, he was named Zheng and given the Zhao surname.

sentences.zh: 年十三歲，莊襄王死，政代立為秦王。

translations.literal: Age thirteen years, Zhuang Xiang Wang died, Zheng replaced stood as Qin king.
translations.idiomatic: At age thirteen, King Zhuang Xiang died, and Zheng succeeded him as king of Qin.

sentences.zh: 當是之時，秦地已并巴、蜀、漢中，越宛有郢，置南郡矣；

translations.literal: When this time, Qin territory already annexed Ba, Shu, Han middle, passed Wan had Ying, established south commandery;
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qin territory had already annexed Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong, passed through Wan and had Ying, and established Nanguo commandery;

sentences.zh: 北收上郡以東，有河東、太原、上黨郡；

translations.literal: North collected Shang commandery east, had Hedong, Taiyuan, Shangdang commanderies;
translations.idiomatic: To the north it collected east of Shang commandery, having Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang commanderies;

sentences.zh: 東至滎陽，滅二周，置三川郡。

translations.literal: East to Xing Yang, extinguished two Zhou, established San Chuan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: To the east it reached Xingyang, extinguished the two Zhou, and established Sanchuan commandery.

sentences.zh: 呂不韋為相，封十萬戶，號曰文信侯。

translations.literal: Lu Bu Wei was chancellor, enfeoffed one hundred thousand households, titled Wen Xin Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Buwei became chancellor, was enfeoffed with one hundred thousand households, and titled Lord Wenxin.

sentences.zh: 招致賓客游士，欲以并天下。

translations.literal: Recruited guests wandering scholars, wished to annex world.
translations.idiomatic: He recruited guests and wandering scholars, desiring to annex the world.

sentences.zh: 李斯為舍人。

translations.literal: Li Si was attendant.
translations.idiomatic: Li Si was his attendant.

sentences.zh: 蒙驁、王齮、麃公等為將軍。

translations.literal: Meng Ao, Wang Qi, Bi Gong etc. were generals.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ao, Wang Qi, Bi Gong, and others were generals.

sentences.zh: 王年少，初即位，委國事大臣。

translations.literal: King young, initially ascended throne, entrusted state affairs to ministers.
translations.idiomatic: The king was young and had just ascended the throne. He entrusted state affairs to the ministers.

translations.literal: Qin Shi Huang was the son of King Zhuang Xiang of Qin. King Zhuang Xiang was a Qin hostage in Zhao. He saw Lü Buwei's concubine, was pleased with her, and took her. She gave birth to Shi Huang. He was born in Handan in the first month of King Zhao of Qin's forty-eighth year. When he was born, he was named Zheng and given the Zhao surname. At age thirteen, King Zhuang Xiang died, and Zheng succeeded him as king of Qin. At this time, Qin territory had already annexed Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong, passed through Wan and had Ying, and established Nanguo commandery; To the north it collected east of Shang commandery, having Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang commanderies; To the east it reached Xingyang, extinguished the two Zhou, and established Sanchuan commandery. Lü Buwei became chancellor, was enfeoffed with one hundred thousand households, and titled Lord Wenxin. He recruited guests and wandering scholars, desiring to annex the world. Li Si was his attendant. Meng Ao, Wang Qi, Bi Gong, and others were generals. The king was young and had just ascended the throne. He entrusted state affairs to the ministers.

sentences.zh: 晉陽反，元年，將軍蒙驁擊定之。

translations.literal: Jin Yang rebelled, first year, general Meng Ao struck pacified it.
translations.idiomatic: Jinyang rebelled. In the first year, General Meng Ao struck and pacified it.

sentences.zh: 二年，麃公將卒攻卷，斬首三萬。

translations.literal: Second year, Bi Gong led troops attacked Juan, beheaded thirty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Bi Gong led troops to attack Juan and beheaded thirty thousand.

sentences.zh: 三年，蒙驁攻韓，取十三城。

translations.literal: Third year, Meng Ao attacked Han, took thirteen cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Han and took thirteen cities.

sentences.zh: 王齮死。

translations.literal: Wang Qi died.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Qi died.

sentences.zh: 十月，將軍蒙驁攻魏氏暢、有詭。

translations.literal: Tenth month, general Meng Ao attacked Wei's Chang, You Gui.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, General Meng Ao attacked Wei's Chang and Yougui.

sentences.zh: 歲大饑。

translations.literal: Year great famine.
translations.idiomatic: There was a great famine that year.

sentences.zh: 四年，拔暢、有詭。

translations.literal: Fourth year, pulled Chang, You Gui.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, they pulled Chang and Yougui.

sentences.zh: 三月，軍罷。

translations.literal: Third month, army dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, the army was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 秦質子歸自趙，趙太子出歸國。

translations.literal: Qin hostage returned from Zhao, Zhao crown prince went out returned to state.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin hostage returned from Zhao. The Zhao crown prince went out and returned to his state.

sentences.zh: 十月庚寅，蝗蟲從東方來，蔽天。

translations.literal: Tenth month Geng Yin, locusts from east came, covered heaven.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month on Gengyin day, locusts came from the east, covering the sky.

sentences.zh: 天下疫。

translations.literal: World epidemic.
translations.idiomatic: There was an epidemic throughout the world.

sentences.zh: 百姓內粟千石，拜爵一級。

translations.literal: Commoners donated grain thousand shi, bestowed nobility one level.
translations.idiomatic: Commoners who donated one thousand shi of grain were bestowed nobility one level.

sentences.zh: 五年，將軍驁攻魏，定酸棗、燕、虛、長平、雍丘、山陽城，皆拔之，取二十城。

translations.literal: Fifth year, general Ao attacked Wei, pacified Suan Zao, Yan, Xu, Chang Ping, Yong Qiu, Shan Yang cities, all pulled them, took twenty cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, General Ao attacked Wei, pacified Suanzhao, Yan, Xu, Changping, Yongqiu, and Shanyang cities. He pulled them all and took twenty cities.

sentences.zh: 初置東郡。

translations.literal: Initially established east commandery.
translations.idiomatic: They initially established Dong commandery.

sentences.zh: 冬雷。

translations.literal: Winter thunder.
translations.idiomatic: There was thunder in winter.

sentences.zh: 六年，韓、魏、趙、衛、楚共擊秦，取壽陵。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Han, Wei, Zhao, Wei, Chu together struck Qin, took Shou Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Han, Wei, Zhao, Wei, and Chu together struck Qin and took Shouling.

sentences.zh: 秦出兵，五國兵罷。

translations.literal: Qin sent out troops, five states troops dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent out troops, and the five states' troops were dismissed.

sentences.zh: 拔衛，迫東郡，其君角率其支屬徙居野王，阻其山以保魏之河內。

translations.literal: Pulled Wei, pressed Dong commandery, its ruler Jiao led his branches relatives moved resided Ye Wang, blocked its mountains to preserve Wei's river inner.
translations.idiomatic: They pulled Wei and pressed Dong commandery. Its ruler Jiao led his branches and relatives to move and reside in Yewang, blocking the mountains to preserve Wei's Henei.

sentences.zh: 七年，彗星先出東方，見北方，五月見西方。

translations.literal: Seventh year, comet first came out east, seen north, fifth month seen west.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, a comet first appeared in the east, was seen in the north, and in the fifth month was seen in the west.

sentences.zh: 將軍驁死。

translations.literal: General Ao died.
translations.idiomatic: General Ao died.

sentences.zh: 以攻龍、孤、慶都，還兵攻汲。

translations.literal: With attacked Long, Gu, Qing Du, returned troops attacked Ji.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Long, Gu, and Qingdu, then returned troops to attack Ji.

sentences.zh: 彗星復見西方十六日。

translations.literal: Comet again seen west sixteen days.
translations.idiomatic: The comet was again seen in the west for sixteen days.

sentences.zh: 夏太后死。

translations.literal: Xia Tai Hou died.
translations.idiomatic: Xia Taihou died.

sentences.zh: 八年，王弟長安君成蟜將軍擊趙，反，死屯留，軍吏皆斬死，遷其民於臨洮。

translations.literal: Eighth year, king's younger brother Chang An Jun Cheng Juan general struck Zhao, rebelled, died Tun Liu, army officials all beheaded died, moved their people to Lin Tao.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, the king's younger brother Lord Chang'an Cheng Juan led troops to strike Zhao, rebelled, died at Tunliu. All army officials were beheaded and died. Their people were moved to Lintao.

sentences.zh: 將軍壁死，卒屯留、蒲鶴反，戮其尸。

translations.literal: General Bi died, troops Tun Liu, Pu He rebelled, mutilated their corpses.
translations.idiomatic: General Bi died. Troops at Tunliu and Puhe rebelled. Their corpses were mutilated.

sentences.zh: 河魚大上，輕車重馬東就食。

translations.literal: River fish greatly ascended, light chariots heavy horses east sought food.
translations.idiomatic: River fish greatly ascended. Light chariots and heavy horses went east to seek food.

translations.literal: Jinyang rebelled. In the first year, General Meng Ao struck and pacified it. In the second year, Bi Gong led troops to attack Juan and beheaded thirty thousand. In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Han and took thirteen cities. Wang Qi died. In the tenth month, General Meng Ao attacked Wei's Chang and Yougui. There was a great famine that year. In the fourth year, they pulled Chang and Yougui. In the third month, the army was dismissed. The Qin hostage returned from Zhao. The Zhao crown prince went out and returned to his state. In the tenth month on Gengyin day, locusts came from the east, covering the sky. There was an epidemic throughout the world. Commoners who donated one thousand shi of grain were bestowed nobility one level. In the fifth year, General Ao attacked Wei, pacified Suanzhao, Yan, Xu, Changping, Yongqiu, and Shanyang cities. He pulled them all and took twenty cities. They initially established Dong commandery. There was thunder in winter. In the sixth year, Han, Wei, Zhao, Wei, and Chu together struck Qin and took Shouling. Qin sent out troops, and the five states' troops were dismissed. They pulled Wei and pressed Dong commandery. Its ruler Jiao led his branches and relatives to move and reside in Yewang, blocking the mountains to preserve Wei's Henei. In the seventh year, a comet first appeared in the east, was seen in the north, and in the fifth month was seen in the west. General Ao died. They attacked Long, Gu, and Qingdu, then returned troops to attack Ji. The comet was again seen in the west for sixteen days. Xia Taihou died. In the eighth year, the king's younger brother Lord Chang'an Cheng Juan led troops to strike Zhao, rebelled, died at Tunliu. All army officials were beheaded and died. Their people were moved to Lintao. General Bi died. Troops at Tunliu and Puhe rebelled. Their corpses were mutilated. River fish greatly ascended. Light chariots and heavy horses went east to seek food.

sentences.zh: 嫪毐封為長信侯。

translations.literal: Lao Ai enfeoffed as Chang Xin Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Lao Ai was enfeoffed as Lord Changxin.

sentences.zh: 予之山陽地，令毐居之。

translations.literal: Gave him Shan Yang land, ordered Ai to reside it.
translations.idiomatic: He was given Shanyang land and ordered to reside there.

sentences.zh: 宮室車馬衣服苑囿馳獵恣毐。

translations.literal: Palaces chambers chariots horses clothes gardens enclosures galloping hunting indulged Ai.
translations.idiomatic: Palaces, chariots, horses, clothes, gardens, enclosures, galloping, and hunting - Ai was indulged in all these.

sentences.zh: 事無小大皆決於毐。

translations.literal: Matters no small great all decided by Ai.
translations.idiomatic: All matters, whether small or great, were decided by Ai.

sentences.zh: 又以河西太原郡更為毐國。

translations.literal: Again with river west Taiyuan commandery changed to Ai state.
translations.idiomatic: The Taiyuan commandery west of the river was again changed to Ai's state.

sentences.zh: 九年，彗星見，或竟天。

translations.literal: Ninth year, comet seen, or crossed heaven.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, a comet was seen, or it crossed the sky.

sentences.zh: 攻魏垣、蒲陽。

translations.literal: Attacked Wei Yuan, Pu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Wei's Yuan and Puying.

sentences.zh: 四月，上宿雍。

translations.literal: Fourth month, Shang lodged Yong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, the emperor lodged at Yong.

sentences.zh: 己酉，王冠，帶劍。

translations.literal: Ji You, king crowned, belted sword.
translations.idiomatic: On Jiyou day, the king was crowned and belted with a sword.

sentences.zh: 長信侯毐作亂而覺，矯王御璽及太后璽以發縣卒及衛卒、官騎、戎翟君公、舍人，將欲攻蘄年宮為亂。

translations.literal: Chang Xin Hou Ai made rebellion and aware, falsified king imperial seal and Tai Hou seal to send county troops and guard troops, official riders, Rong Di jun gong, attendants, intending to attack Qi Nian palace for rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Changxin Ai made rebellion and it was discovered. He falsified the king's imperial seal and the queen mother's seal to send county troops, guard troops, official riders, Rongdi lords and nobles, and attendants. He intended to attack the Qinian palace and cause rebellion.

sentences.zh: 王知之，令相國昌平君、昌文君發卒攻毐。

translations.literal: King knew it, ordered chancellor Chang Ping Jun, Chang Wen Jun sent troops attacked Ai.
translations.idiomatic: The king knew it and ordered Chancellor Lord Changping and Lord Changwen to send troops to attack Ai.

sentences.zh: 戰咸陽，斬首數百，皆拜爵，及宦者皆在戰中，亦拜爵一級。

translations.literal: Fought Xian Yang, beheaded several hundred, all bestowed nobility, and eunuchs all in battle middle, also bestowed nobility one level.
translations.idiomatic: They fought at Xianyang and beheaded several hundred. All were bestowed nobility, and the eunuchs who were in the battle were also bestowed nobility one level.

sentences.zh: 毐等敗走。

translations.literal: Ai etc. defeated fled.
translations.idiomatic: Ai and the others were defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 即令國中：有生得毐，賜錢百萬；

translations.literal: Immediately ordered state middle: who alive captures Ai, grants money one million;
translations.idiomatic: He immediately ordered throughout the state: whoever captures Ai alive will be granted one million cash;

sentences.zh: 殺之，五十萬。

translations.literal: Kills him, five hundred thousand.
translations.idiomatic: whoever kills him, five hundred thousand.

sentences.zh: 盡得毐等。

translations.literal: Completely obtained Ai etc.
translations.idiomatic: They completely obtained Ai and the others.

sentences.zh: 衛尉竭、內史肆、佐弋竭、中大夫令齊等二十人皆梟首。

translations.literal: Wei Wei Jie, Nei Shi Si, Zuo Yi Jie, Zhong Da Fu Ling Qi etc. twenty people all owl heads.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wei Jie, Nei Shi Si, Zuo Yi Jie, Zhong Da Fu Ling Qi and twenty others all had their heads displayed on poles.

sentences.zh: 車裂以徇，滅其宗。

translations.literal: Cart torn to display, extinguished their clan.
translations.idiomatic: They were torn apart by carts for display and their clans extinguished.

sentences.zh: 及其舍人，輕者為鬼薪。

translations.literal: And their attendants, light ones became ghost firewood.
translations.idiomatic: And their attendants - the lighter ones became ghost firewood workers.

sentences.zh: 及奪爵遷蜀四千餘家，家房陵。

translations.literal: And stripped nobility moved Shu four thousand more families, families Fang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: And nobility was stripped and more than four thousand families were moved to Shu, each family to Fangling.

sentences.zh: （四）［是］月寒凍，有死者。

translations.literal: This month cold froze, had dead ones.
translations.idiomatic: This month had severe cold and freezing, with some dying.

sentences.zh: 楊端和攻衍氏。

translations.literal: Yang Duan He attacked Yan Shi.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Duan He attacked Yanshi.

sentences.zh: 彗星見西方，又見北方，從斗以南八十日。

translations.literal: Comet seen west, again seen north, from Dou south eighty days.
translations.idiomatic: A comet was seen in the west, and again in the north, from Dou southward for eighty days.

sentences.zh: 十年，相國呂不韋坐嫪毐免。

translations.literal: Tenth year, chancellor Lu Bu Wei sat Lao Ai dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Chancellor Lü Buwei was dismissed due to Lao Ai.

sentences.zh: 桓齮為將軍。

translations.literal: Huan Yi was general.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Yi became general.

sentences.zh: 齊、趙來置酒。

translations.literal: Qi, Zhao came set up wine.
translations.idiomatic: Qi and Zhao came to set up a wine feast.

sentences.zh: 齊人茅焦說秦王曰：「秦方以天下為事，而大王有遷母太后之名，恐諸侯聞之，由此倍秦也。」

translations.literal: Qi person Mao Jiao persuaded Qin king said: 'Qin just with world as matter, yet great king has moved mother Tai Hou name, fear feudal lords hear it, thereby double Qin also.'
translations.idiomatic: The Qi man Mao Jiao persuaded the Qin king saying: 'Qin is just making the world its business, yet Your Majesty has the name of having moved Mother Taihou. I fear the feudal lords will hear of it and thereby turn against Qin.'

sentences.zh: 秦王乃迎太后於雍而入咸陽，復居甘泉宮。

translations.literal: Qin king then welcomed Tai Hou at Yong and entered Xian Yang, again resided Gan Quan palace.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king then welcomed the Taihou at Yong and entered Xianyang, again residing in the Ganquan palace.

translations.literal: Lao Ai was enfeoffed as Lord Changxin. He was given Shanyang land and ordered to reside there. Palaces, chariots, horses, clothes, gardens, enclosures, galloping, and hunting - Ai was indulged in all these. All matters, whether small or great, were decided by Ai. The Taiyuan commandery west of the river was again changed to Ai's state. In the ninth year, a comet was seen, or it crossed the sky. They attacked Wei's Yuan and Puying. In the fourth month, the emperor lodged at Yong. On Jiyou day, the king was crowned and belted with a sword. Lord Changxin Ai made rebellion and it was discovered. He falsified the king's imperial seal and the queen mother's seal to send county troops, guard troops, official riders, Rongdi lords and nobles, and attendants. He intended to attack the Qinian palace and cause rebellion. The king knew it and ordered Chancellor Lord Changping and Lord Changwen to send troops to attack Ai. They fought at Xianyang and beheaded several hundred. All were bestowed nobility, and the eunuchs who were in the battle were also bestowed nobility one level. Ai and the others were defeated and fled. He immediately ordered throughout the state: whoever captures Ai alive will be granted one million cash; whoever kills him, five hundred thousand. They completely obtained Ai and the others. Wei Wei Jie, Nei Shi Si, Zuo Yi Jie, Zhong Da Fu Ling Qi and twenty others all had their heads displayed on poles. They were torn apart by carts for display and their clans extinguished. And their attendants - the lighter ones became ghost firewood workers. And nobility was stripped and more than four thousand families were moved to Shu, each family to Fangling. This month had severe cold and freezing, with some dying. Yang Duan He attacked Yanshi. A comet was seen in the west, and again in the north, from Dou southward for eighty days. In the tenth year, Chancellor Lü Buwei was dismissed due to Lao Ai. Huan Yi became general. Qi and Zhao came to set up a wine feast. The Qi man Mao Jiao persuaded the Qin king saying: 'Qin is just making the world its business, yet Your Majesty has the name of having moved Mother Taihou. I fear the feudal lords will hear of it and thereby turn against Qin.' The Qin king then welcomed the Taihou at Yong and entered Xianyang, again residing in the Ganquan palace.

sentences.zh: 大索，逐客，李斯上書說，乃止逐客令。

translations.literal: Great search, expel guests, Li Si presented memorial persuaded, then stopped expel guests command.
translations.idiomatic: A great search was conducted and guests were expelled. Li Si presented a memorial persuading the king, and the expel guests command was stopped.

sentences.zh: 李斯因說秦王，請先取韓以恐他國，於是使斯下韓。

translations.literal: Li Si therefore persuaded Qin king, requested first take Han to frighten other states, thereupon made Si go down to Han.
translations.idiomatic: Li Si therefore persuaded the Qin king, requesting to first take Han to frighten the other states. Thereupon he had Si go down to Han.

sentences.zh: 韓王患之。

translations.literal: Han king worried it.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king was worried about it.

sentences.zh: 與韓非謀弱秦。

translations.literal: With Han Fei plotted weaken Qin.
translations.idiomatic: With Han Fei he plotted to weaken Qin.

sentences.zh: 大梁人尉繚來，說秦王曰：「以秦之彊，諸侯譬如郡縣之君，臣但恐諸侯合從，翕而出不意，此乃智伯、夫差、湣王之所以亡也。

translations.literal: Da Liang person Wei Liao came, persuaded Qin king said: 'With Qin's strength, feudal lords like commandery county rulers, minister only fears feudal lords allied together, suddenly come out unexpectedly, this namely Zhi Bo, Fu Cha, Min Wang reason perished.'
translations.idiomatic: The Daliang man Wei Liao came and persuaded the Qin king saying: 'With Qin's strength, the feudal lords are like rulers of commanderies and counties. I only fear that the feudal lords will ally together and suddenly strike unexpectedly. This is why Zhi Bo, Fu Cha, and King Min perished.'

sentences.zh: 願大王毋愛財物，賂其豪臣，以亂其謀，不過亡三十萬金，則諸侯可盡。」

translations.literal: Wish great king not love wealth objects, bribe their powerful ministers, to disrupt their plans, no more lose three hundred thousand gold, then feudal lords can exhaust.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish Your Majesty not to love wealth and objects, but to bribe their powerful ministers to disrupt their plans. It will cost no more than three hundred thousand gold, and then the feudal lords can be exhausted.'

sentences.zh: 秦王從其計，見尉繚亢禮，衣服食飲與繚同。

translations.literal: Qin king followed his plan, saw Wei Liao proud ceremony, clothes food drink with Liao same.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king followed his plan. He saw Wei Liao with proud ceremony, and his clothes, food, and drink were the same as Liao's.

sentences.zh: 繚曰：「秦王為人，蜂準，長目，摯鳥膺，豺聲，少恩而虎狼心，居約易出人下，得志亦輕食人。

translations.literal: Liao said: 'Qin king as person, bee nose, long eyes, determined bird breast, jackal voice, little kindness but tiger wolf heart, reside poverty easily comes out person below, obtains will also lightly eats person.
translations.idiomatic: Liao said: 'The Qin king as a person has a bee-like nose, long eyes, a determined bird-like breast, jackal voice, little kindness but a tiger-wolf heart. When in poverty he easily puts himself below others, but when he obtains his will he also lightly eats people.'

sentences.zh: 我布衣，然見我常身自下我。

translations.literal: I common clothes, yet sees me often body self lowers me.
translations.idiomatic: I am in common clothes, yet when he sees me he often lowers himself below me.'

sentences.zh: 誠使秦王得志於天下，天下皆為虜矣。

translations.literal: Truly make Qin king obtain will in world, world all become captives.'
translations.idiomatic: Truly, if the Qin king obtains his will in the world, the world will all become captives.'

sentences.zh: 不可與久游。」

translations.literal: Cannot with long travel.'
translations.idiomatic: One cannot travel with him for long.'

sentences.zh: 乃亡去。

translations.literal: Then fled away.
translations.idiomatic: He then fled away.

sentences.zh: 秦王覺，固止，以為秦國尉，卒用其計策。

translations.literal: Qin king aware, firmly stopped, made Qin state wei, finally used his strategies.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king became aware and firmly stopped him. He made him the Wei of Qin state and finally used his strategies.

sentences.zh: 而李斯用事。

translations.literal: And Li Si handled affairs.
translations.idiomatic: And Li Si handled affairs.

translations.literal: A great search was conducted and guests were expelled. Li Si presented a memorial persuading the king, and the expel guests command was stopped. Li Si therefore persuaded the Qin king, requesting to first take Han to frighten the other states. Thereupon he had Si go down to Han. The Han king was worried about it. With Han Fei he plotted to weaken Qin. The Daliang man Wei Liao came and persuaded the Qin king saying: 'With Qin's strength, the feudal lords are like rulers of commanderies and counties. I only fear that the feudal lords will ally together and suddenly strike unexpectedly. This is why Zhi Bo, Fu Cha, and King Min perished.' I wish Your Majesty not to love wealth and objects, but to bribe their powerful ministers to disrupt their plans. It will cost no more than three hundred thousand gold, and then the feudal lords can be exhausted.' The Qin king followed his plan. He saw Wei Liao with proud ceremony, and his clothes, food, and drink were the same as Liao's. Liao said: 'The Qin king as a person has a bee-like nose, long eyes, a determined bird-like breast, jackal voice, little kindness but a tiger-wolf heart. When in poverty he easily puts himself below others, but when he obtains his will he also lightly eats people.' I am in common clothes, yet when he sees me he often lowers himself below me.' Truly, if the Qin king obtains his will in the world, the world will all become captives.' One cannot travel with him for long.' He then fled away. The Qin king became aware and firmly stopped him. He made him the Wei of Qin state and finally used his strategies. And Li Si handled affairs.

sentences.zh: 十一年，王翦、桓齮、楊端和攻鄴，取九城。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Wang Jian, Huan Yi, Yang Duan He attacked Ye, took nine cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Wang Jian, Huan Yi, and Yang Duan He attacked Ye and took nine cities.

sentences.zh: 王翦攻閼與、橑楊，皆并為一軍。

translations.literal: Wang Jian attacked E Yu, Lao Yang, all combined as one army.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Jian attacked Eyu and Laoyang, combining them all as one army.

sentences.zh: 翦將十八日，軍歸斗食以下，什推二人從軍取鄴安陽，桓齮將。

translations.literal: Jian general eighteen days, army returned dou shi below, shi push two persons followed army took Ye An Yang, Huan Yi general.
translations.idiomatic: Jian was general for eighteen days. The army returned with those of dou shi rank and below. Every shi had two pushed to follow the army and take Ye and Anyang. Huan Yi was general.

sentences.zh: 十二年，文信侯不韋死，竊葬。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Wen Xin Hou Bu Wei died, secretly buried.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Lord Wenxin Buwei died and was secretly buried.

sentences.zh: 其舍人臨者，晉人也逐出之；

translations.literal: His attendants attending ones, Jin people also drove out them;
translations.idiomatic: His attendants who attended - the Jin people were also driven out;

sentences.zh: 秦人六百石以上奪爵，遷；

translations.literal: Qin people six hundred shi above stripped nobility, moved;
translations.idiomatic: Qin people of six hundred shi rank and above had their nobility stripped and were moved;

sentences.zh: 五百石以下不臨，遷，勿奪爵。

translations.literal: Five hundred shi below not attend, moved, do not strip nobility.
translations.idiomatic: Those of five hundred shi rank and below who did not attend were moved but not stripped of nobility.

sentences.zh: 自今以來，操國事不道如嫪毐、不韋者籍其門，視此。

translations.literal: From now on, handle state affairs not properly like Lao Ai, Bu Wei ones register their gates, regard this.
translations.idiomatic: From now on, those who handle state affairs improperly like Lao Ai and Buwei will have their gates registered. Regard this.

sentences.zh: 秋，復嫪毐舍人遷蜀者。

translations.literal: Autumn, again Lao Ai attendants moved Shu ones.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, those who were Lao Ai's attendants and moved to Shu were again moved.

sentences.zh: 當是之時，天下大旱，六月至八月乃雨。

translations.literal: When this time, world great drought, sixth month to eighth month then rained.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, there was a great drought throughout the world. It rained from the sixth month to the eighth month.

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Wang Jian, Huan Yi, and Yang Duan He attacked Ye and took nine cities. Wang Jian attacked Eyu and Laoyang, combining them all as one army. Jian was general for eighteen days. The army returned with those of dou shi rank and below. Every shi had two pushed to follow the army and take Ye and Anyang. Huan Yi was general. In the twelfth year, Lord Wenxin Buwei died and was secretly buried. His attendants who attended - the Jin people were also driven out; Qin people of six hundred shi rank and above had their nobility stripped and were moved; Those of five hundred shi rank and below who did not attend were moved but not stripped of nobility. From now on, those who handle state affairs improperly like Lao Ai and Buwei will have their gates registered. Regard this. In autumn, those who were Lao Ai's attendants and moved to Shu were again moved. At this time, there was a great drought throughout the world. It rained from the sixth month to the eighth month.

sentences.zh: 十三年，桓齮攻趙平陽，殺趙將扈輒，斬首十萬。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Huan Yi attacked Zhao Ping Yang, killed Zhao general Hu Zhe, beheaded one hundred thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Huan Yi attacked Zhao's Pingyang, killed Zhao's general Hu Zhe, and beheaded one hundred thousand.

sentences.zh: 王之河南。

translations.literal: King went to river south.
translations.idiomatic: The king went to Henan.

sentences.zh: 正月，彗星見東方。

translations.literal: First month, comet seen east.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month, a comet was seen in the east.

sentences.zh: 十月，桓齮攻趙。

translations.literal: Tenth month, Huan Yi attacked Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, Huan Yi attacked Zhao.

sentences.zh: 十四年，攻趙軍於平陽，取宜安，破之，殺其將軍。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, attacked Zhao army at Ping Yang, took Yi An, broke it, killed their general.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, they attacked the Zhao army at Pingyang, took Yian, broke it, and killed their general.

sentences.zh: 桓齮定平陽、武城。

translations.literal: Huan Yi pacified Ping Yang, Wu Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Yi pacified Pingyang and Wucheng.

sentences.zh: 韓非使秦，秦用李斯謀，留非，非死雲陽。

translations.literal: Han Fei sent Qin, Qin used Li Si plan, detained Fei, Fei died Yun Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Han Fei was sent to Qin. Qin used Li Si's plan, detained Fei, and Fei died in Yunyang.

sentences.zh: 韓王請為臣。

translations.literal: Han king requested to be minister.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king requested to become a minister.

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Huan Yi attacked Zhao's Pingyang, killed Zhao's general Hu Zhe, and beheaded one hundred thousand. The king went to Henan. In the first month, a comet was seen in the east. In the tenth month, Huan Yi attacked Zhao. In the fourteenth year, they attacked the Zhao army at Pingyang, took Yian, broke it, and killed their general. Huan Yi pacified Pingyang and Wucheng. Han Fei was sent to Qin. Qin used Li Si's plan, detained Fei, and Fei died in Yunyang. The Han king requested to become a minister.

sentences.zh: 十五年，大興兵，一軍至鄴，一軍至太原，取狼孟。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, greatly raised troops, one army to Ye, one army to Tai Yuan, took Lang Meng.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, troops were greatly raised. One army went to Ye, one army to Taiyuan, and took Langmeng.

sentences.zh: 地動。

translations.literal: Earth moved.
translations.idiomatic: There was an earthquake.

sentences.zh: 十六年九月，發卒受地韓南陽假守騰。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year ninth month, sent troops received land Han Nan Yang acting guard Teng.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month of the sixteenth year, troops were sent to receive land from Han's Nanyang. Acting guard Teng.

sentences.zh: 初令男子書年。

translations.literal: Initially ordered males register age.
translations.idiomatic: Males were initially ordered to register their age.

sentences.zh: 魏獻地於秦。

translations.literal: Wei offered land to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Wei offered land to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦置麗邑。

translations.literal: Qin established Li yi.
translations.idiomatic: Qin established Liyi.

sentences.zh: 十七年，內史騰攻韓，得韓王安，盡納其地，以其地為郡，命曰潁川。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, nei shi Teng attacked Han, got Han king An, completely took his land, with his land as commandery, named Ying Chuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Nei Shi Teng attacked Han, got Han King An, and completely took his land. His land was made into a commandery named Yingchuan.

sentences.zh: 地動。

translations.literal: Earth moved.
translations.idiomatic: There was an earthquake.

sentences.zh: 華陽太后卒。

translations.literal: Hua Yang Tai Hou died.
translations.idiomatic: Hua Yang Taihou died.

sentences.zh: 民大饑。

translations.literal: People great famine.
translations.idiomatic: The people suffered a great famine.

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, troops were greatly raised. One army went to Ye, one army to Taiyuan, and took Langmeng. There was an earthquake. In the ninth month of the sixteenth year, troops were sent to receive land from Han's Nanyang. Acting guard Teng. Males were initially ordered to register their age. Wei offered land to Qin. Qin established Liyi. In the seventeenth year, Nei Shi Teng attacked Han, got Han King An, and completely took his land. His land was made into a commandery named Yingchuan. There was an earthquake. Hua Yang Taihou died. The people suffered a great famine.

sentences.zh: 十八年，大興兵攻趙，王翦將上地，下井陘，端和將河內，羌瘣伐趙，端和圍邯鄲城。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, greatly raised troops attacked Zhao, Wang Jian general upper land, descended Jing Xing, Duan He general river inner, Qiang Wei attacked Zhao, Duan He surrounded Han Dan city.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, troops were greatly raised to attack Zhao. Wang Jian was general of the upper lands and descended through Jingxing. Duan He was general of Henei. Qiang Wei attacked Zhao, and Duan He surrounded Handan city.

sentences.zh: 十九年，王翦、羌瘣盡定取趙地東陽，得趙王。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Wang Jian, Qiang Wei completely pacified took Zhao land Dong Yang, got Zhao king.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Wang Jian and Qiang Wei completely pacified and took Zhao's Dongyang land and got the Zhao king.

sentences.zh: 引兵欲攻燕，屯中山。

translations.literal: Led troops wished attack Yan, stationed Zhong Shan.
translations.idiomatic: They led troops desiring to attack Yan and stationed at Zhongshan.

sentences.zh: 秦王之邯鄲，諸嘗與王生趙時母家有仇怨，皆阬之。

translations.literal: Qin king to Han Dan, those once with king born Zhao time mother family had enmities, all pit them.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king went to Handan. Those who once had enmities with the king's mother's family from when he was born in Zhao were all pit-killed.

sentences.zh: 秦王還，從太原、上郡歸。

translations.literal: Qin king returned, from Tai Yuan, Shang commandery returned.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king returned, going back through Taiyuan and Shang commandery.

sentences.zh: 始皇帝母太后崩。

translations.literal: Shi Huang Di mother Tai Hou collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Huangdi's mother Taihou collapsed.

sentences.zh: 趙公子嘉率其宗數百人之代，自立為代王，東與燕合兵，軍上谷。

translations.literal: Zhao gong zi Jia led his clan several hundred people to Dai, self established as Dai king, east with Yan combined troops, stationed Shang Gu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gong Zi Jia led several hundred of his clansmen to Dai, established himself as Dai king, combined troops with Yan to the east, and stationed at Shanggu.

sentences.zh: 大饑。

translations.literal: Great famine.
translations.idiomatic: There was a great famine.

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, troops were greatly raised to attack Zhao. Wang Jian was general of the upper lands and descended through Jingxing. Duan He was general of Henei. Qiang Wei attacked Zhao, and Duan He surrounded Handan city. In the nineteenth year, Wang Jian and Qiang Wei completely pacified and took Zhao's Dongyang land and got the Zhao king. They led troops desiring to attack Yan and stationed at Zhongshan. The Qin king went to Handan. Those who once had enmities with the king's mother's family from when he was born in Zhao were all pit-killed. The Qin king returned, going back through Taiyuan and Shang commandery. Shi Huangdi's mother Taihou collapsed. Zhao Gong Zi Jia led several hundred of his clansmen to Dai, established himself as Dai king, combined troops with Yan to the east, and stationed at Shanggu. There was a great famine.

sentences.zh: 二十年，燕太子丹患秦兵至國，恐，使荊軻刺秦王。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, Yan crown prince Dan worried Qin troops to state, feared, made Jing Ke stab Qin king.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Yan Crown Prince Dan, worried that Qin troops would reach his state, feared, and had Jing Ke stab the Qin king.

sentences.zh: 秦王覺之，體解軻以徇，而使王翦、辛勝攻燕。

translations.literal: Qin king aware of it, bodily dismembered Ke to display, and made Wang Jian, Xin Sheng attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king became aware of it, had Ke bodily dismembered for display, and had Wang Jian and Xin Sheng attack Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕、代發兵擊秦軍，秦軍破燕易水之西。

translations.literal: Yan, Dai sent troops struck Qin army, Qin army broke Yan Yi Shui west.
translations.idiomatic: Yan and Dai sent troops to strike the Qin army. The Qin army broke Yan west of the Yishui.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，王賁攻（薊）［荊］。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, Wang Ben attacked Jing.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Wang Ben attacked Jing.

sentences.zh: 乃益發卒詣王翦軍，遂破燕太子軍，取燕薊城，得太子丹之首。

translations.literal: Then additionally sent troops went to Wang Jian army, then broke Yan crown prince army, took Yan Ji city, got crown prince Dan's head.
translations.idiomatic: They then additionally sent troops to Wang Jian's army, broke the Yan crown prince's army, took Yan's Ji city, and got Crown Prince Dan's head.

sentences.zh: 燕王東收遼東而王之。

translations.literal: Yan king east collected Liao Dong and kinged it.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan king collected Liaodong to the east and became king there.

sentences.zh: 王翦謝病老歸。

translations.literal: Wang Jian declined illness old returned.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Jian declined due to illness and old age and returned.

sentences.zh: 新鄭反。

translations.literal: Xin Zheng rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: Xinzheng rebelled.

sentences.zh: 昌平君徙於郢。

translations.literal: Chang Ping Jun moved to Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Changping moved to Ying.

sentences.zh: 大雨雪，深二尺五寸。

translations.literal: Great rained snow, deep two chi five cun.
translations.idiomatic: There was a great snowfall, two chi and five cun deep.

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Yan Crown Prince Dan, worried that Qin troops would reach his state, feared, and had Jing Ke stab the Qin king. The Qin king became aware of it, had Ke bodily dismembered for display, and had Wang Jian and Xin Sheng attack Yan. Yan and Dai sent troops to strike the Qin army. The Qin army broke Yan west of the Yishui. In the twenty-first year, Wang Ben attacked Jing. They then additionally sent troops to Wang Jian's army, broke the Yan crown prince's army, took Yan's Ji city, and got Crown Prince Dan's head. The Yan king collected Liaodong to the east and became king there. Wang Jian declined due to illness and old age and returned. Xinzheng rebelled. Lord Changping moved to Ying. There was a great snowfall, two chi and five cun deep.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，王賁攻魏，引河溝灌大梁，大梁城壞，其王請降，盡取其地。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Wang Ben attacked Wei, led river ditch irrigated Da Liang, Da Liang city bad, its king requested surrender, completely took its land.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Wang Ben attacked Wei, led river channels to irrigate Daliang, Daliang's city was damaged, its king requested surrender, and they completely took its land.

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Wang Ben attacked Wei, led river channels to irrigate Daliang, Daliang's city was damaged, its king requested surrender, and they completely took its land.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，秦王復召王翦，彊起之，使將擊荊。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Qin king again summoned Wang Jian, forced raised him, made general strike Jing.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, the Qin king again summoned Wang Jian, forcibly raised him, and made him general to strike Jing.

sentences.zh: 取陳以南至平輿，虜荊王。

translations.literal: Took Chen south to Ping Yu, captured Jing king.
translations.idiomatic: They took from Chen south to Pingyu and captured the Jing king.

sentences.zh: 秦王游至郢陳。

translations.literal: Qin king toured to Ying Chen.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king toured to Yingchen.

sentences.zh: 荊將項燕立昌平君為荊王，反秦於淮南。

translations.literal: Jing general Xiang Yan established Chang Ping Jun as Jing king, rebelled Qin at Huai south.
translations.idiomatic: Jing's general Xiang Yan established Lord Changping as Jing king and rebelled against Qin in Huainan.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，王翦、蒙武攻荊，破荊軍，昌平君死，項燕遂自殺。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Wang Jian, Meng Wu attacked Jing, broke Jing army, Chang Ping Jun died, Xiang Yan then suicide.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Wang Jian and Meng Wu attacked Jing, broke the Jing army, Lord Changping died, and Xiang Yan then committed suicide.

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, the Qin king again summoned Wang Jian, forcibly raised him, and made him general to strike Jing. They took from Chen south to Pingyu and captured the Jing king. The Qin king toured to Yingchen. Jing's general Xiang Yan established Lord Changping as Jing king and rebelled against Qin in Huainan. In the twenty-fourth year, Wang Jian and Meng Wu attacked Jing, broke the Jing army, Lord Changping died, and Xiang Yan then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，大興兵，使王賁將，攻燕遼東，得燕王喜。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, greatly raised troops, made Wang Ben general, attacked Yan Liao Dong, got Yan king Xi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, troops were greatly raised, Wang Ben was made general, attacked Yan's Liaodong, and got Yan King Xi.

sentences.zh: 還攻代，虜代王嘉。

translations.literal: Returned attacked Dai, captured Dai king Jia.
translations.idiomatic: They returned and attacked Dai, capturing Dai King Jia.

sentences.zh: 王翦遂定荊江南地；

translations.literal: Wang Jian then pacified Jing Jiang south land;
translations.idiomatic: Wang Jian then pacified Jing's land south of the Jiang;

sentences.zh: 降越君，置會稽郡。

translations.literal: Surrendered Yue jun, established Hui Ji commandery.
translations.idiomatic: They surrendered the Yue jun and established Huiji commandery.

sentences.zh: 五月，天下大酺。

translations.literal: Fifth month, world great fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, there was a great fu throughout the world.

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, troops were greatly raised, Wang Ben was made general, attacked Yan's Liaodong, and got Yan King Xi. They returned and attacked Dai, capturing Dai King Jia. Wang Jian then pacified Jing's land south of the Jiang; They surrendered the Yue jun and established Huiji commandery. In the fifth month, there was a great fu throughout the world.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，齊王建與其相後勝發兵守其西界，不通秦。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, Qi king Jian with his chancellor Hou Sheng sent troops guarded his west border, not connected Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi King Jian and his chancellor Hou Sheng sent troops to guard his western border and did not connect with Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦使將軍王賁從燕南攻齊，得齊王建。

translations.literal: Qin made general Wang Ben from Yan south attacked Qi, got Qi king Jian.
translations.idiomatic: Qin had General Wang Ben attack Qi from south of Yan and got Qi King Jian.

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi King Jian and his chancellor Hou Sheng sent troops to guard his western border and did not connect with Qin. Qin had General Wang Ben attack Qi from south of Yan and got Qi King Jian.

sentences.zh: 秦王初并天下，令丞相、御史曰：「異日韓王納地效璽，請為藩臣，已而倍約，與趙、魏合從畔秦，故興兵誅之，虜其王。

translations.literal: Qin king initially united world, commanded chancellor, imperial secretary said: 'Different day Han king entered land presented seal, requested to be fief minister, already then doubled agreement, with Zhao, Wei allied together rebelled Qin, therefore raised troops executed them, captured their king.
translations.idiomatic: When the Qin king initially united the world, he commanded the chancellor and imperial secretary saying: 'Previously, the Han king entered land and presented his seal, requesting to be a fief minister, but then he doubled the agreement and allied with Zhao and Wei to rebel against Qin. Therefore we raised troops and executed them, capturing their king.

sentences.zh: 寡人以為善，庶幾息兵革。

translations.literal: I considered good, perhaps ceased weapons armor.
translations.idiomatic: I considered it good, perhaps to cease weapons and armor.'

sentences.zh: 趙王使其相李牧來約盟，故歸其質子。

translations.literal: Zhao king made his chancellor Li Mu come allied covenant, therefore returned their hostage son.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king had his chancellor Li Mu come to ally and covenant, therefore we returned their hostage son.

sentences.zh: 已而倍盟，反我太原，故興兵誅之，得其王。

translations.literal: Already then doubled covenant, rebelled our Tai Yuan, therefore raised troops executed them, got their king.
translations.idiomatic: But then they doubled the covenant and rebelled against our Taiyuan. Therefore we raised troops and executed them, getting their king.

sentences.zh: 趙公子嘉乃自立為代王，故舉兵擊滅之。

translations.literal: Zhao gong zi Jia then self established as Dai king, therefore raised troops struck extinguished them.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gong Zi Jia then self-established as Dai king. Therefore we raised troops and struck to extinguish them.

sentences.zh: 魏王始約服入秦，已而與韓、趙謀襲秦，秦兵吏誅，遂破之。

translations.literal: Wei king began agreed submitted entered Qin, already then with Han, Zhao plotted raided Qin, Qin troops officials executed, then broke them.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei king initially agreed to submit and enter Qin, but then plotted with Han and Zhao to raid Qin. Qin's troops and officials executed them, then broke them.

sentences.zh: 荊王獻青陽以西，已而畔約，擊我南郡，故發兵誅，得其王，遂定其荊地。

translations.literal: Jing king offered Qing Yang west, already then rebelled agreement, struck our south commandery, therefore sent troops executed, got their king, then pacified their Jing land.
translations.idiomatic: The Jing king offered west of Qingyang, but then rebelled against the agreement and struck our Nanguo commandery. Therefore we sent troops and executed them, got their king, and then pacified their Jing land.

sentences.zh: 燕王昏亂，其太子丹乃陰令荊軻為賊，兵吏誅，滅其國。

translations.literal: Yan king muddled chaotic, his crown prince Dan then secretly ordered Jing Ke as bandit, troops officials executed, extinguished their state.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan king was muddled and chaotic. His crown prince Dan secretly ordered Jing Ke to be a bandit. Our troops and officials executed them and extinguished their state.

sentences.zh: 齊王用后勝計，絕秦使，欲為亂，兵吏誅，虜其王，平齊地。

translations.literal: Qi king used Hou Sheng plan, cut off Qin envoys, wished for rebellion, troops officials executed, captured their king, pacified Qi land.

translations.literal: The Beginning Emperor set wine at Xianyang palace, seventy scholars before him wished him longevity. Pushe Zhou Qingchen advanced and praised, saying: 'In other times Qin's lands did not exceed a thousand li. Relying on Your Majesty's divine spirit and clear holiness, he pacified and settled within the seas, drove out the barbarian Yi. What the sun and moon shone upon, none did not submit and obey. He made the feudal lords into commanderies and counties. People each were peaceful and happy by themselves, without the troubles of warfare, transmitted to ten thousand generations. From high antiquity it did not reach Your Majesty's might and virtue.' The Beginning Emperor was pleased. Scholar Qi person Chun Yuyue advanced and said: 'I, your minister, have heard that the kings of Yin and Zhou lasted over a thousand years. They enfeoffed sons, younger brothers, and meritorious ministers, themselves making branch supports. Now Your Majesty possesses within the seas, yet sons and younger brothers are common men. Suddenly there are ministers like Tian Chang and the Six Ministers, without support or brush, how can they mutually save each other?' Affairs that do not take ancient as teacher yet are able to last long, are not what I have heard. Now Qingchen also flatters to the face to increase Your Majesty's errors. He is not a loyal minister.' The Beginning Emperor sent down their discussion. Chancellor Li Si said: 'The Five Emperors did not mutually repeat, the Three Dynasties did not mutually follow. Each governed with what was appropriate, not opposing and reversing each other. Time changed and was different. Now Your Majesty has created a great enterprise, established merit for ten thousand generations. This is certainly not what foolish scholars know. Moreover, Yue's words are matters of the Three Dynasties. What are they sufficient to model? In different times the feudal lords together contended, thickly recruiting wandering scholars. Now the world is already determined, laws and commands come out as one. When common people are at home they exert themselves in agriculture and labor, scholars study and learn the laws and commands to avoid prohibitions. Now the various scholars do not take the present as teacher but study the ancient, to oppose the current age, confusing and disordering the qianshou. Chancellor Minister Si, risking death, speaks: In ancient times the world was scattered and chaotic, none could unify it. Therefore the feudal lords together arose. Their words all spoke of ancient to harm the present, adorned empty words to disorder reality. People favored their private studies to oppose what superiors established. Now the emperor has united the world, distinguishes black and white and determines one honored. Private studies mutually go with illegal teachings. When people hear commands descend, they each discuss them with their studies. Entering, their hearts oppose; exiting, they discuss in alleys. They boast of their master as a name, take different things as high, lead the group below to make slander. Like this if not prohibited, then the ruler's power descends to the superiors, factions and alliances form below. Prohibiting it is convenient. I, your minister, request that court historians burn all records that are not of Qin. Those not in the charge of scholar officials: throughout the world, whoever dares hide poems, books, or the words of the hundred schools, shall completely go to the commandery governors and commandery lieutenants to mix and burn them. Whoever dares to discuss poems and books in pairs shall be abandoned in the market. Those who use ancient to oppose the present shall be clanned. Officials who see and know but do not report shall share the same crime. If the command descends thirty days and they do not burn, tattoo them as city morning. What shall not be removed: books of medicine, divination, planting trees. If they desire to study the laws and commands, take officials as teachers.' The decree said: 'Approved.'

translations.idiomatic: Moreover the world once united hearts and united strength to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 當此之世，賢智并列，良將行其師，賢相通其謀，然困於阻險而不能進，秦乃延入戰而為之開關，百萬之徒逃北而遂壞。

translations.literal: At this time, worthy wise parallel arrayed, good generals marched their armies, worthy chancellors communicated their plans, however trapped by blocked dangers could not advance, Qin then lured them battle opened passes, million multitudes fled north then destroyed.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, worthy and wise were parallel arrayed, good generals marched their armies, worthy chancellors communicated their plans. However they were trapped by blocked dangers and could not advance. Qin then lured them into battle and opened the passes. The million multitudes fled north and were then destroyed.

sentences.zh: 豈勇力智慧不足哉？

translations.literal: How courage strength wisdom insufficient ah?
translations.idiomatic: How was courage, strength, and wisdom insufficient?

sentences.zh: 形不利，勢不便也。

translations.literal: Form unfavorable, situation inconvenient also.
translations.idiomatic: The form was unfavorable, the situation inconvenient.

sentences.zh: 秦小邑并大城，守險塞而軍，高壘毋戰，閉關據阨，荷戟而守之。

translations.literal: Qin small cities united large cities, guarded dangerous barriers stationed armies, high ramparts not battle, closed passes occupied defiles, carried halberds guarded them.
translations.idiomatic: Qin united small cities into large cities, guarded dangerous barriers and stationed armies, high ramparts did not battle, closed passes and occupied defiles, carried halberds and guarded them.

sentences.zh: 諸侯起於匹夫，以利合，非有素王之行也。

translations.literal: Feudal lords rose from common men, with profit united, not had prepared king conduct also.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords rose from common men, united by profit, did not have prepared king conduct.

sentences.zh: 其交未親，其下未附，名為亡秦，其實利之也。

translations.literal: Their relations not close, their below not attached, named perished Qin, actually profited it also.
translations.idiomatic: Their relations were not close, their below were not attached. They were named as perishing Qin, but actually profited from it.

sentences.zh: 彼見秦阻之難犯也，必退師。

translations.literal: They saw Qin barriers difficult violate also, certainly retreated armies.
translations.idiomatic: They saw Qin's barriers were difficult to violate, certainly retreated their armies.

sentences.zh: 安土息民，以待其敝，收弱扶罷，以令大國之君，不患不得意於海內。

translations.literal: Pacified land rested people, to await their exhaustion, gathered weak supported tired, to command great countries lords, not worried not obtained intention within seas.
translations.idiomatic: They pacified the land and rested the people, to await their exhaustion, gathered the weak and supported the tired, to command the great countries' lords. They were not worried about not obtaining their intention within the seas.

sentences.zh: 貴為天子，富有天下，而身為禽者，其救敗非也。

translations.literal: Noble as emperor, rich had world, but body became prey ones, their rescue defeat wrong also.
translations.idiomatic: Noble as emperor, rich and had the world, but the body became prey. Their rescue of defeat was wrong.

translations.literal: Qin's land was covered by mountains and girded by rivers as solid fortifications. It was a country of four barriers. From Duke Mu since, to the Qin king, twenty more lords constantly were the feudal lords' hero. How were they worthy generation after generation? Their situation was obviously so. Moreover the world once united hearts and united strength to attack Qin. At this time, worthy and wise were parallel arrayed, good generals marched their armies, worthy chancellors communicated their plans. However they were trapped by blocked dangers and could not advance. Qin then lured them into battle and opened the passes. The million multitudes fled north and were then destroyed. How was courage, strength, and wisdom insufficient? The form was unfavorable, the situation inconvenient. Qin united small cities into large cities, guarded dangerous barriers and stationed armies, high ramparts did not battle, closed passes and occupied defiles, carried halberds and guarded them. The feudal lords rose from common men, united by profit, did not have prepared king conduct. Their relations were not close, their below were not attached. They were named as perishing Qin, but actually profited from it. They saw Qin's barriers were difficult to violate, certainly retreated their armies. They pacified the land and rested the people, to await their exhaustion, gathered the weak and supported the tired, to command the great countries' lords. They were not worried about not obtaining their intention within the seas. Noble as emperor, rich and had the world, but the body became prey. Their rescue of defeat was wrong.

sentences.zh: 秦王足己不問，遂過而不變。

translations.literal: Qin king satisfied self not asked, then erred not changed.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king was satisfied with himself and did not ask, then erred and did not change.

sentences.zh: 二世受之，因而不改，暴虐以重禍。

translations.literal: Second generation received it, followed not changed, violent cruel to increase calamities.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Generation received it, followed and did not change, violent and cruel to increase calamities.

sentences.zh: 子嬰孤立無親，危弱無輔。

translations.literal: Zi Ying isolated no relatives, dangerous weak no assistants.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ying was isolated with no relatives, dangerous and weak with no assistants.

sentences.zh: 三主惑而終身不悟，亡，不亦宜乎？

translations.literal: Three lords confused lifelong not awoke, perished, not also proper ah?
translations.idiomatic: The three lords were confused and lifelong did not awake. They perished. Was this not also proper?

sentences.zh: 當此時也，世非無深慮知化之士也，然所以不敢盡忠拂過者，秦俗多忌諱之禁，忠言未卒於口而身為戮沒矣。

translations.literal: At this time, world not without deep thought knew change scholars also, however what dared not exhaust loyalty opposed faults ones, Qin customs many taboo prohibitions, loyal words not finished in mouth body became executed drowned already.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the world was not without deep-thinking scholars who knew change. However those who dared not exhaust loyalty and oppose faults, Qin customs had many taboo prohibitions. Loyal words were not finished in the mouth when the body became executed and drowned.

sentences.zh: 故使天下之士，傾耳而聽，重足而立，拑口而不言。

translations.literal: Therefore made world scholars, inclined ears listened, heavy feet stood, shut mouths not spoke.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it made the world's scholars incline their ears and listen, stand with heavy feet, shut their mouths and not speak.

sentences.zh: 是以三主失道，忠臣不敢諫，智士不敢謀，天下已亂，姦不上聞，豈不哀哉！

translations.literal: Therefore three lords lost way, loyal ministers not dared remonstrate, wise scholars not dared plan, world already chaotic, evil not up heard, how not sorrowful ah!
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the three lords lost the way, loyal ministers did not dare remonstrate, wise scholars did not dare plan. The world was already chaotic, evil was not heard above. How was this not sorrowful!

sentences.zh: 先王知雍蔽之傷國也，故置公卿大夫士，以飾法設刑，而天下治。

translations.literal: Former kings knew blocking obstructing harmed country also, therefore established nobles grand masters scholars, to adorn laws set punishments, and world governed.
translations.idiomatic: Former kings knew that blocking and obstructing harmed the country. Therefore they established nobles, grand masters, and scholars to adorn laws and set punishments, and the world was governed.

sentences.zh: 其彊也，禁暴誅亂而天下服。

translations.literal: Their strong also, prohibited violence executed chaos and world submitted.
translations.idiomatic: When they were strong, they prohibited violence and executed chaos, and the world submitted.

sentences.zh: 其弱也，五伯征而諸侯從。

translations.literal: Their weak also, five hegemons campaigned and feudal lords followed.
translations.idiomatic: When they were weak, the five hegemons campaigned and the feudal lords followed.

sentences.zh: 其削也，內守外附而社稷存。

translations.literal: Their reduced also, inner guarded outer attached and altars earth existed.
translations.idiomatic: When they were reduced, inner guarded and outer attached, and the altars of earth existed.

sentences.zh: 故秦之盛也，繁法嚴刑而天下振；

translations.literal: Therefore Qin prosperity also, numerous laws strict punishments and world shook;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore when Qin prospered, numerous laws and strict punishments made the world shake;

sentences.zh: 及其衰也，百姓怨望而海內畔矣。

translations.literal: Reached their decline also, common people resented hoped and within seas rebelled already.
translations.idiomatic: When it reached their decline, the common people resented and hoped, and within the seas rebelled.

sentences.zh: 故周五序得其道，而千餘歲不絕。

translations.literal: Therefore Zhou five sequences obtained their way, thousand more years not extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Zhou's five sequences obtained their way, and a thousand more years did not extinguish.

sentences.zh: 秦本末并失，故不長久。

translations.literal: Qin root end both lost, therefore not long lasting.
translations.idiomatic: Qin's root and end were both lost, therefore not long lasting.

sentences.zh: 由此觀之，安危之統相去遠矣。

translations.literal: From this observed, peace danger succession far apart already.
translations.idiomatic: From this observed, the succession of peace and danger were far apart.

sentences.zh: 野諺曰「前事之不忘，後事之師也」。

translations.literal: Rural proverb said 'former matters not forget, later matters teacher also'.
translations.idiomatic: The rural proverb says: 'Not forgetting former matters is the teacher of later matters.'

sentences.zh: 是以君子為國，觀之上古，驗之當世，參以人事，察盛衰之理，審權勢之宜，去就有序，變化有時，故曠日長久而社稷安矣。

translations.literal: Therefore superior men for country, observed ancient times, verified current world, referenced with human affairs, examined prosperity decline principles, carefully weighed power influence propriety, leaving taking had order, changes had time, therefore broad days long lasting and altars earth peaceful already.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore superior men for the country observe ancient times, verify the current world, reference with human affairs, examine prosperity and decline principles, carefully weigh power and influence propriety, leaving and taking have order, changes have their time. Therefore broad days long lasting and the altars of earth are peaceful.

sentences.zh: 秦孝公據殽函之固，擁雍州之地，君臣固守而窺周室，有席卷天下，包舉宇內，囊括四海之意，并吞八荒之心。

translations.literal: Qin Xiao gong occupied Xiao Han solid, embraced Yong province land, ruler ministers firmly guarded spied Zhou chambers, had roll up world, wrap universe within, bag encompass four seas intention, unite swallow eight wastes heart.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Duke Xiao occupied Xiaohan's solid fortifications, embraced Yong province land. Ruler and ministers firmly guarded and spied on Zhou chambers. They had the intention to roll up the world, wrap the universe within, encompass the four seas in a bag. Their heart was to unite and swallow the eight wastes.

sentences.zh: 當是時，商君佐之，內立法度，務耕織，修守戰之備，外連衡而鬬諸侯，於是秦人拱手而取西河之外。

translations.literal: At this time, Shang jun assisted him, internally established laws measures, devoted agriculture weaving, repaired defense battle preparations, externally connected horizontally fought feudal lords, thereupon Qin people clasped hands took Xi River beyond.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Lord Shang assisted him. Internally established laws and measures, devoted to agriculture and weaving, repaired defense and battle preparations. Externally connected horizontally and fought the feudal lords. Thereupon Qin people clasped hands and took beyond the Xi River.

translations.literal: Qin Duke Xiao occupied Xiaohan's solid fortifications, embraced Yong province land. Ruler and ministers firmly guarded and spied on Zhou chambers. They had the intention to roll up the world, wrap the universe within, encompass the four seas in a bag. Their heart was to unite and swallow the eight wastes. At this time, Lord Shang assisted him. Internally established laws and measures, devoted to agriculture and weaving, repaired defense and battle preparations. Externally connected horizontally and fought the feudal lords. Thereupon Qin people clasped hands and took beyond the Xi River.

sentences.zh: 孝公既沒，惠王、武王蒙故業，因遺冊，南兼漢中，西舉巴、蜀，東割膏腴之地，收要害之郡。

translations.literal: Xiao gong already died, Hui wang, Wu wang inherited former achievements, followed remaining plans, south united Han Zhong, west took Ba, Shu, east cut fertile lands, collected strategic commanderies.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao already died. King Hui and King Wu inherited the former achievements, followed the remaining plans. South united Hanzhong, west took Ba and Shu, east cut fertile lands, collected strategic commanderies.

sentences.zh: 諸侯恐懼，會盟而謀弱秦，不愛珍器重寶肥美之地，以致天下之士，合從締交，相與為一。

translations.literal: Feudal lords feared, assembled allied plotted weaken Qin, not cherished precious vessels heavy treasures fertile beautiful lands, to attract world scholars, allied together formed relations, mutually became one.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords feared, assembled and allied to plot weakening Qin. They did not cherish precious vessels, heavy treasures, fertile beautiful lands, to attract the world's scholars. They allied together and formed relations, mutually becoming one.

sentences.zh: 當是時，齊有孟嘗，趙有平原，楚有春申，魏有信陵。

translations.literal: At this time, Qi had Meng Chang, Zhao had Ping Yuan, Chu had Chun Shen, Wei had Xin Ling.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qi had Mengchang, Zhao had Pingyuan, Chu had Chunshen, Wei had Xinling.

sentences.zh: 此四君者，皆明知而忠信，寬厚而愛人，尊賢重士，約從離衡，并韓、魏、燕、楚、齊、趙、宋、衛、中山之眾。

translations.literal: These four lords, all clear knowledge loyal trustworthy, generous thick loved people, honored worthy valued scholars, allied together separated horizontal, united Han Wei Yan Chu Qi Zhao Song Wei Zhong Shan multitudes.
translations.idiomatic: These four lords were all clear in knowledge and loyal trustworthy, generous and thick in loving people, honored the worthy and valued scholars. They allied together and separated the horizontal alliances, united the multitudes of Han, Wei, Yan, Chu, Qi, Zhao, Song, Wei, and Zhongshan.

sentences.zh: 於是六國之士有寧越、徐尚、蘇秦、杜赫之屬為之謀，齊明、周最、陳軫、昭滑、樓緩、翟景、蘇厲、樂毅之徒通其意，吳起、孫臏、帶佗、兒良、王廖、田忌、廉頗、趙奢之朋制其兵。

translations.literal: Thereupon six states scholars had Ning Yue, Xu Shang, Su Qin, Du He kind made their plans, Qi Ming, Zhou Zui, Chen Zhen, Zhao Hua, Lou Huan, Di Jing, Su Li, Yue Yi kind communicated their intentions, Wu Qi, Sun Bin, Dai Tuo, Er Liang, Wang Liao, Tian Ji, Lian Po, Zhao She companions controlled their troops.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the six states' scholars had Ning Yue, Xu Shang, Su Qin, Du He's kind make their plans. Qi Ming, Zhou Zui, Chen Zhen, Zhao Hua, Lou Huan, Di Jing, Su Li, Yue Yi's kind communicated their intentions. Wu Qi, Sun Bin, Dai Tuo, Er Liang, Wang Liao, Tian Ji, Lian Po, Zhao She's companions controlled their troops.

sentences.zh: 常以十倍之地，百萬之眾，叩關而攻秦。

translations.literal: Constantly with ten times land, million multitudes, knocked passes attacked Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Constantly with ten times the land and million multitudes, they knocked on the passes and attacked Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦人開關延敵，九國之師逡巡遁逃而不敢進。

translations.literal: Qin people opened passes lured enemy, nine states armies hesitated fled escaped not dared advance.
translations.idiomatic: Qin people opened the passes and lured the enemy. The nine states' armies hesitated, fled, and escaped without daring to advance.

sentences.zh: 秦無亡矢遺鏃之費，而天下諸侯已困矣。

translations.literal: Qin without lost arrow remaining arrowhead expense, and world feudal lords already trapped already.
translations.idiomatic: Qin had no expense of lost arrows and remaining arrowheads, and the world's feudal lords were already trapped.

sentences.zh: 於是從散約解，爭割地而奉秦。

translations.literal: Thereupon alliances scattered agreements dissolved, contended divided lands offered Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the alliances scattered and agreements dissolved. They contended to divide lands and offer to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦有餘力而制其敝，追亡逐北，伏尸百萬，流血漂鹵。

translations.literal: Qin had surplus strength controlled their exhaustion, pursued fled chased north, prostrate corpses million, flowing blood floated shields.
translations.idiomatic: Qin had surplus strength and controlled their exhaustion. They pursued the fled and chased north. Prostrate corpses numbered a million. Flowing blood floated shields.

sentences.zh: 因利乘便，宰割天下，分裂河山，彊國請服，弱國入朝。

translations.literal: Took advantage rode convenience, butchered world, split rivers mountains, strong countries requested submission, weak countries entered court.
translations.idiomatic: They took advantage and rode convenience, butchered the world, split rivers and mountains. Strong countries requested submission, weak countries entered court.

sentences.zh: 延及孝文王、莊襄王，享國日淺，國家無事。

translations.literal: Extended to Xiao Wen wang, Zhuang Xiang wang, enjoyed country days shallow, state no affairs.
translations.idiomatic: It extended to King Xiao Wen and King Zhuang Xiang. They enjoyed the country for shallow days. The state had no affairs.

sentences.zh: 及至秦王，續六世之餘烈，振長策而御宇內，吞二周而亡諸侯，履至尊而制六合，執棰拊以鞭笞天下，威振四海。

translations.literal: Reached Qin wang, continued six generations remaining achievements, shook long whip drove universe within, swallowed two Zhou perished feudal lords, trod supreme honor controlled six directions, grasped stick patted whipped lashed world, might shook four seas.
translations.idiomatic: When it reached the Qin king, he continued the six generations' remaining achievements, shook the long whip and drove within the universe. He swallowed the two Zhou and perished the feudal lords. He trod supreme honor and controlled the six directions. He grasped stick and patted to whip and lash the world. His might shook the four seas.

sentences.zh: 南取百越之地，以為桂林、象郡，百越之君俛首系頸，委命下吏。

translations.literal: South took hundred Yue lands, made Gui Lin, Xiang commandery, hundred Yue lords bowed heads tied necks, entrusted lives lower officials.
translations.idiomatic: South he took the hundred Yue lands, made Guilin and Xiang commandery. The hundred Yue lords bowed heads and tied necks, entrusted their lives to lower officials.

sentences.zh: 乃使蒙恬北筑長城而守藩籬，卻匈奴七百餘里，胡人不敢南下而牧馬，士不敢彎弓而報怨。

translations.literal: Then made Meng Tian north built long wall guarded fence hedge, repelled Xiongnu seven hundred more li, Hu people not dared south descended pastured horses, scholars not dared bent bows repaid grievances.
translations.idiomatic: Then he had Meng Tian build the long wall north to guard the fence and hedge. He repelled the Xiongnu seven hundred more li. Hu people did not dare descend south and pasture horses. Scholars did not dare bend bows and repay grievances.

sentences.zh: 於是廢先王之道，焚百家之言，以愚黔首。

translations.literal: Thereupon abolished former kings way, burned hundred schools words, to foolish qian shou.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he abolished the former kings' way, burned the hundred schools' words, to make foolish the qianshou.

sentences.zh: 墮名城，殺豪俊，收天下之兵聚之咸陽，銷鋒鑄鐻，以為金人十二，以弱黔首之民。

translations.literal: Destroyed famous cities, killed heroic outstanding, collected world weapons gathered Xianyang, melted edges cast bells, made gold men twelve, to weaken qian shou people.
translations.idiomatic: He destroyed famous cities, killed the heroic and outstanding, collected the world's weapons and gathered them at Xianyang. Melted the edges and cast bells, made twelve gold men, to weaken the qianshou people.

sentences.zh: 然後斬華為城，因河為津，據億丈之城，臨不測之谿以為固。

translations.literal: Then cut Hua as city, followed river as ford, occupied hundred million zhang city, faced unfathomable ravine as solid.
translations.idiomatic: Then he cut Hua as city, followed the river as ford, occupied the hundred million zhang city, faced the unfathomable ravine as solid fortifications.

sentences.zh: 良將勁弩守要害之處，信臣精卒陳利兵而誰何，天下以定。

translations.literal: Good generals strong crossbows guarded strategic places, trustworthy ministers elite soldiers displayed sharp weapons who what, world thereby settled.
translations.idiomatic: Good generals and strong crossbows guarded the strategic places. Trustworthy ministers and elite soldiers displayed sharp weapons and challenged who-what. The world thereby settled.

translations.literal: Qin wang heart, self thought Guan Zhong solid, gold city thousand li, descendants emperor king ten thousand generations undertaking also.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king's heart thought Guanzhong was solid, a gold city of thousand li, his descendants' emperor king ten thousand generations undertaking.

sentences.zh: 秦王既沒，餘威振於殊俗。

translations.literal: Qin wang already died, remaining might shook different customs.
